intro: Hieracium camptoclados, commonly known as the bent-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slight bend, giving it its common name. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, attracting various pollinators.
